percolation

Class Percolation

  • java.lang.Object
    • percolation.Percolation

  • public class Percolation
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Percolation for Assignment Percolation used to run the Percolation Visualizer.
    Author:
    Carlos Martinez

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Percolation(int n)
      This constructor creates an object of Percolation.

      This Method Checks how many Sites are Opened This Method is Not Required in the Assignment, it is just used to test the code.

      This Method opens the site of a given index.

      This Method just checks if the program percolates, if the method is connected from top to bottom.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Percolation

        public Percolation(int n)
        This constructor creates an object of Percolation.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of Rows and columns in each row. It is a square so it uses the same variable.

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public void open(int i,
                 int j)
        This Method opens the site of a given index. Top left Corner equals (0,0), The method is also responsible for connecting the unions connections that gives the functionality to the rest of the program.
        Parameters:
        i - The row location
        j - The column location

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen(int i,
                      int j)
        This Method just Checks if the site of a certain index is open
        Parameters:
        i - The row location
        j - The column location
        Returns:
        boolean, returns true id the site is open, returns false if the site is not open.

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull(int i,
                      int j)
        This method Just Checks if the site is connected to the top given their location. Top left corner (0,0)
        Parameters:
        i - The Row location
        j - The column location
        Returns:
        boolean, true if site is connected to the top returns false if the site is not connected to the top

      • percolates

        public boolean percolates()
        This Method just checks if the program percolates, if the method is connected from top to bottom.
        Returns:
        boolean, true if top and bottom are connecting false if top and bottom are not connected.

      • numberOfOpenSites

        public int numberOfOpenSites()
        This Method Checks how many Sites are Opened This Method is Not Required in the Assignment, it is just used to test the code.
        Returns:
        Number of Sites that are Opened
